intro: Astronia zambalensis, commonly known as the Zambal astronia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
